channel.title: Opera is MUCH faster than Firefox on Linux
channel.description:
Opera is MUCH faster than Firefox on Linux. Maybe Opera sucks on winbloze, but it rocks on Linux.
I've installed both. Opera doesn't leak memory, renders pages mostly the same way Firefox does, takes little memory, starts up fast, closes fast, has a beautiful interface and renders pages VERY fast compared to firefox. Highly recommended over Firefox for Linux.
Also, opera has some very nice themes, especially the "tango" theme that imitates GTK. It looks really nice.

item.title: Opera is MUCH faster than Firefox on Linux
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I was wondering because I’ve had GNash (gnu flash) crash before. Personally I am happy with firefox, I have been using it since version 0.4, and have never noticed it being slow in starting or loading pages.

Read full topic
item.source: Opera is MUCH faster than Firefox on Linux

item.title: Opera is MUCH faster than Firefox on Linux
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

I’m using all proprietary plugins and everything works perfectly, never crashed. Video players work fine too.

Read full topic
item.source: Opera is MUCH faster than Firefox on Linux

item.title: Opera is MUCH faster than Firefox on Linux
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:3, topic:161162”][quote author=juju link=topic=219402.msg1903220#msg1903220 date=1196269899]
I use Opera, but, I have never managed to get the plugins all working nicely on Linux. An example of this is that I cannot have two tabs open that both have a flash application on them - if I do, Opera crashes. I also have issues with a all the embedded video players and such.
[/quote]

Do you use the GNU plugins? or the proprietary ones?[/quote]

proprietary - see http://www.opera.com/linux/docs/plugins/install/#flash

Read full topic
